title: NOC not mandatory to open the Mahakalipadpu RuB as claimed by Mangaluru Smart City, says Railways

title: RSS no paramilitary organisation; can‚Äôt be understood by looking at BJP, says Mohan Bhagwat
content: RSS works to unite society and imbue it with the necessary qualities and virtues to ensure that India does not fall into the clutches of a foreign power again, Mohan Bhagwat said

title: Sri Lankan Navy arrests nine fishermen from Mayiladuthurai
content: The arrest comes a day after the Sri Lankan Navy apprehended 11 fishermen from the Karaikal region on charges of crossing the IMBL

title: 18 people arrested in Assam's Karbi Anglong for murdering couple over witchcraft suspicion
content: During the inspection of the place of occurrence, police seized soil mixed with blood samples, one wooden stick, one plastic Gamla containing cow dung liquid, suspected to have been used to wipe out blood stains

title: Leaders pay tribute to freedom fighters Rani Velu Nachiyar, Veerapandiya Kattabomman
content: In a post on X, Vice President of India C.P. Radhakrishnan described Rani Velu Nachiyar as an enduring icon of women‚Äôs strength and leadership and one of India‚Äôs earliest woman freedom fighters

content: The crackdown was carried out under Operation Cy-Hawk, launched to dismantle organised cyber fraud networks and to choke illicit financial channels used for routing cheated money

title: Kerala MLA and former Minister Antony Raju found guilty in evidence tampering case
content: Verdict comes 19 years after chargesheet was filed against the Thiruvananthapuram MLA. He was accused of tampering with an Australian‚Äôs underwear, which was seized as material evidence in a drugs case

content: It is learnt that top Maoist leaders Mangtu in Sukma and Hunga Madkam in Bijapur are also among those killed

content: Thrissur MP says ‚Äòfor the development of Kerala, there should either be a BJP government or a situation where BJP can influence governance‚Äô

title: PM Modi hails Savitribai Phule on her birth anniversary

content: Gaurav Gogoi claimed that people's right to criticise, a crucial element in a democracy, was being taken away by the BJP-led coalition government

content: Maharashtra State Election Commission has ordered a probe into reports of unopposed elections of candidates in the State for the municipal corporation elections to be held on January 15

content: PM calls Rajajinagar MLA Suresh Kumar to congratulate him on his 702-km cycling expedition that was taken up after recovering from a rare medical complication

title: Congress appoints district presidents in 11 Himachal districts after over 13 months
content: The appointments followed the submission of reports by All India Congress Committee (AICC) observers, who conducted district-wise reviews and held interactions with party functionaries and stakeholders

title: Maharashtra civic polls: 68 Mahayuti candidates elected unopposed, including 44 of BJP
content: This includes 44 of the BJP, with the highest number being from Kalyan-Dombivli Municipal Corporation in Thane district, followed by Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad, Panvel, Bhiwandi, Dhule, Jalgaon and Ahilyanagar

content: The accused has been identified as Pramod Kumar Raj, a resident of Bhagwanpur in the Bochaha police station area

content: Officials said this is the first community radio station on the LoC, which aims to counter misinformation and propaganda from across the border

title: Zelenskyy says he wants to replace Ukraine‚Äôs Defence Minister
content: Mikhailo Fedorov, who has been the Minister of Digital Transformation since 2019 was the position of the new Ukrainian Defence Minister

title: The Aravalli hills are shaken with the sound of machinery
content: A 2-billion-year-old range has been battered and bruised by mining, waste dumping, and encroachment, say environmentalists and those who live in its shadow. The Supreme Court order accepting the changed definition of the Aravalli hills caused further worry, though it has since been stayed.¬†Ishita Mishra¬†reports on the people living in the foothills, who believe that decisions about the Aravallis should involve and benefit communities

title: Signature campaign in Kolkata to protect tamarind tree planted by revolutionary 70 years ago
content: A movement to save the tree was started in July 2024 after builders took over the property where the freedom fighter lived and when it seemed the tree would be taken down anytime

title: Nalagarh blast: Two groups claim responsibility; Himachal police scans CCTV footage to nab accused
content: Teams have been constituted to scan CCTV footage, and the police are coordinating with the Punjab Police and the National Investigation Agency (NIA) for the probe

title: LoP Suvendu Adhikari calls West Bengal a ‚ÄòBengali Hindu homeland‚Äô
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party MLA said that once the saffron party will provide 200 days of rural work, countering Trinamool‚Äôs claim that it will provide 100 days on employment under Karmashree Prakalpa

title: Police ask X to remove video of assault on migrant worker
content: The incident occurred on December 26 near the railway quarters in Tiruttani, where 4 juveniles attacked the man from Odisha with a weapon. They recorded the act and uploaded it online

title: NIA shifts a Delhi blast accused to Kashmir, scans forest area in Shopian
content: Multiple teams of the NIA reached Padpawan area of Shopian district along with Yasir Dar, the ninth accused in the case. Officials said a forest area was scanned based on the questioning of the accused

title: Aviation sector to take wings in A.P. as Bhogapuram airport all set for flight validation test on January 4
content: The project undertaken during the NDA‚Äôs tenure between 2014 and 2019 after the State bifurcation is expected to be ready by June 30

title: Distribution of pattadar passbooks with State Emblem begins in A.P.
content: Naidu, who is abroad, reviews the exercise through teleconference; 22 lakh passbooks will be distributed in villages where re-survey has been completed

title: Natural disasters taking heavy toll on Himachal, says report; experts seek policy changes
content: The Himachal Pradesh Human Development Report 2025 said that as Himachal continues to grapple with shifting weather patterns and an increasing number of natural disasters, the economic losses have been high and the human toll substantial

title: Nitish Kumar seeks union government help for better upkeep of Kumhrar Park maintained by ASI
content: He gave the instruction during the inspection of the park and the historical site located in Patna. The Chief Minister also viewed the remains of pillars from the Magadha Empire period preserved in the Kumhrar Park complex.

title: EOW of Odisha police arrest financial fraudster accused of swindling ‚Çπ120 crore
content: Arrested from Bankura district of West Bengal, the accused Amit Mandal had collected deposits from 600 gullible investors

title: Reduce number of shops on Marina Beach, Madras HC tells Chennai Corporation
content: Justices R. Suresh Kumar and A.D. Jagadish Chandira suggest that only eatables, toys & souvenirs should be sold in the beach

title: India‚Äôs deep dive into the frozen frontier
content: A team of scientists, including one from Hyderabad-based INCOIS, has successfully deployed and retrieved an autonomous ocean glider in the Southern Ocean, marking a big leap in the country‚Äôs polar and deep-ocean research capabilities

title: Historic bell set to ring again at 172-year-old church in Secunderabad
content: Restoration of 80-foot bell tower using traditional lime-and-mortar techniques nears completion; tower commemorates missionary Lillian Burgess, who perished in a 19th-century shipwreck while bringing a bell for the church

title: Theyyam to light up Thiruvananthapuram during Assembly book festival
content: Fourth edition of the Kerala Legislative Assembly International Book Festival will be organised from January 7 to 13

title: Government to help teachers use AI; will ease open schooling framework
content: Education Ministry hopes Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill will pass during Budget Session; wants to create pathways for non-school institutes, such as ITIs, to offer open schooling programmes under NIOS

title: Health scheme for ex-servicemen facing crisis due to govt. apathy, says Congress
content: Congress says the Centre has reduced budget allocations for the medical scheme benefitting ex-servicemen; the party will start an agitation if the government does not release funds by January 30

title: Supreme Court condemns denial of bail to give accused a ‚Äòtaste of imprisonment as a lesson‚Äô
content: Even if allegations are serious, every undertrial should be presumed innocent, court tells enforcement agencies

title: Two arrested for raping 2 children of tribal labourers in Maharashtra
content: The two girls did not speak about the incident for four days as the two accused had threatened them with dire consequences; the incident came to light when one of them needed medical attention after complaining of pain

title: Barred from Jama Masjid, Mirwaiz‚Äôs online sermon calls for ‚Äòdialogue on Kashmir‚Äô
content: ‚ÄúDespite making unilateral changes in 2019, the reality is that the Kashmir conflict continues to keep the region in an unsettled state that can erupt anytime‚Äù

title: BJP alleges ‚Äòmaha jungle raj‚Äô in Bengal, says Mamata ‚Äòthreatened‚Äô Amit Shah
content: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia says Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee had threatened Union Home Minister Amit Shah from entering the State

title: Congress alleges 15 deaths in Indore as official toll stands at 5
content: Team of senior doctors will analyse media reports of deaths related to drinking water contamination¬†and update official figures, says Collector; two senior municipal corporation officials suspended as Congress seeks accountability and action

title: Community workshop on Spinal Muscular Atrophy held in Thiruvananthapuram
content: SMA is a rare neuromuscular disorder characterised by the degeneration of motor neurons, leading to progressive muscle weakness and wasting

title: CEC member visits Bannerghatta National Park, interacts with farmers
content: The petition argued that the notification regarding the reduction of the ESZ has excluded ecologically critical areas surrounding established elephant corridors

title: Tourist access to Kashmir‚Äôs¬†Margan Top, Chauhar Nag, Sinthan Top banned over security
content: According to an order issued by the SDM, Kokernag, inputs from police and security agencies indicated security vulnerabilities in certain high-altitude and forested areas

title: ED arrests IAS officer from Gujarat in bribery-linked money laundering case
content: Rajendrakumar Patel, a 2015-batch IAS officer, was serving as Surendranagar Collector until he was transferred without a new posting last week

title: Karur MP flags ‚Äònon-cooperation‚Äô by TNCC in naming booth-level agents
content: Jothimani alleges that she was facing obstructions in submitting the list of polling booth agents to the Election Commission and says TNCC is in the news for all wrong reasons

title: Land acquisition a major issue in infrastructure development: Cabinet Secretary
content: The government has not calculated the savings due to timely monitoring of the schemes by PRAGATI portal, says Cabinet Secretary

title: Madurai Bench of Madras High Court imposes restrictions on Santhanakoodu Urus on the Thirupparankundram¬†hill
content: Justice S.¬†Srimathy¬†restrains the¬†dargah¬†authorities from carrying out animal sacrifice, carrying meat and non-vegetarian food, and cooking non-vegetarian food. The direction should be enforced from the foothills to the top, the court has said

title: Vellappally-Binoy Viswam spat takes an ugly turn
content: CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan  moderates his stance against Vellappally, saying his party¬†will not ¬†consider him a communal bigot for an isolated remark

title: IT Ministry orders X to ‚Äòaudit‚Äô and cease morphed pictures of women in Grok chatbot
content: The Ministry ordered the social media platform to undertake a ‚Äúcomprehensive audit‚Äù of its AI chatbot to ensure it does not generate such imagery

title: Activists allege threatening calls ahead of public hearing on proposal for a chemical factory
content: The residents of Malgi village oppose proposal to set up high-risk chemical industry in their village

title: 'Bihari girls available for marriage for Rs 25k': U'khand minister's husband sparks row
content: Uttarakhand minister Rekha Arya's husband sparked outrage with a remark suggesting Bihari girls are available for weddings at low prices. Political parties across Bihar condemned the statement, with the Bihar State Women Commission issuing a notice. Leaders demanded an apology and action against him.

title: BCCI steps in: KKR asked to release Mustafizur Rahman
content: The BCCI has intervened in the political controversy surrounding Kolkata Knight Riders' signing of Mustafizur Rahman, asking the franchise to release the Bangladeshi pacer for the 2026 IPL season. This decision follows sharp political and religious objections to the player's inclusion, stemming from strained India-Bangladesh relations and concerns over violence in the neighboring country.

title: Nagpur parents go to work, chain 12-yr-old 'habitual thief' at home
content: A 12-year-old boy in Nagpur was rescued after being chained and locked by his parents for hours daily over two months due to alleged cellphone theft. The school dropout, showing injuries from restraints and signs of trauma, has been moved to a government home for children. Police are investigating the incident.

title: 'Lost confidence': Meta's most famous employee reveals truth behind his exit
content: AI luminary Yann LeCun is leaving Meta after a decade, citing fundamental disagreements with CEO Mark Zuckerberg over the company's AI strategy. LeCun believes large language models are a 'dead end' for superintelligence, a view clashing with Meta's massive investment.

title: Chhattisgarh encounter: Over 10 Maoists killed in Sukma, 2 in Bijapur
content: Security forces have eliminated 14 Maoists in separate encounters in Chhattisgarh's Sukma and Bijapur districts. The anti-insurgency operation, which began early Saturday, resulted in the recovery of bodies and a significant cache of weapons. Police sources indicated that commanders allegedly involved in the killing of Konta ASP Akash Rao Girepunje have been neutralized.

title: Elon Musk's father Errol Musk says 'America will collapse if ‚Ä¶'
content: Errol Musk, father of Tesla CEO Elon Musk, has sparked controversy with remarks predicting a US 'collapse' due to the white population becoming a minority within two decades. He also downplayed systemic oppression in South Africa, claiming white populations significantly contributed to Black African development.

title: Maharashtra civic polls: 39 Mahayuti candidates win unopposed across 4 bodies
content: A significant number of unopposed victories, totaling 39 across four civic bodies near Mumbai, have sparked opposition allegations of bias and coercion. The State Election Commission will investigate these claims, particularly concerning withdrawals favouring BJP and Shinde Sena candidates. This early advantage for the ruling alliance has drawn criticism from various parties.

title: Bank holiday on Hazrat Ali: Where are banks closed on January 3? Check list
content: As 2026 begins, Indian banks will observe numerous national and state-specific holidays, impacting branch operations. Customers should consult the bank holiday calendar to avoid disruptions for in-branch transactions, though digital services remain accessible. Key closures include January 3rd for Hazrat Ali's birthday in Uttar Pradesh and January 26th for Republic Day nationwide.

title: 'The end of me': Google's Eric Schmidt on AI; says 55 years of coding wiped out
content: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt believes AI's rapid advancement, already handling 10-20% of programming tasks, signals the end of traditional coding careers. He sees AI's true economic power in automating corporate functions like billing and accounting, not just coding. Schmidt also predicts Artificial General Intelligence by 2029, urging human oversight to preserve agency.

title: New Year stabbings rock Delhi; tailor, teen, rickshaw driver killed in separate attacks
content: New Year's Eve turned tragic in Delhi with three separate stabbing incidents claiming as many lives. A tailor was killed after confronting noisy youths, an e-rickshaw driver died in a street brawl, and a 15-year-old boy was fatally stabbed. Investigations are underway, with some arrests made.

title: TN shocker: Man, live-in partner charred to death as group locks hut, sets it on fire
content: A 53-year-old man and his live-in partner were found charred to death in their hut in Tiruvannamalai district after it was allegedly set on fire by unidentified individuals. Police are investigating the suspicious deaths, considering potential involvement of the victims' estranged spouses. The couple had been living together for three years.

title: Paulina Gretzky net worth 2025: wealth and career highlights
content: The daughter of a legendary hockey player, Wayne Gretzky, and a wife to a pro golf player, Dustin Johnson, Paulina Gretzky has established her own way in the industry of entertainment and social media. Having a net worth of five million dollars, she has been successful in business, modeling, and acting. It has also been reported that she will inherit a large portion of her father's fortune.

title: Now, Pakistan backs China's claim that it mediated during Op Sindoor
content: Pakistan has now endorsed China's claim of mediating the May 2025 India-Pakistan conflict, a move that raises eyebrows given India's stance.  Islamabad's foreign office spokesperson stated Chinese leaders were in contact with both nations, contributing to de-escalation. This assertion contrasts with India's position that the conflict pause followed a request from Pakistan's DGMO, not third-party intervention.

title: IndiGo travel disruptions: How to claim compensation vouchers ‚Äî details inside
content: IndiGo has launched its 'Gesture of Care' package, offering affected passengers travel vouchers worth INR 10,000. This initiative assists those severely impacted by flight delays and cancellations between December 3rd and 5th, 2025. The vouchers are valid for twelve months and can be used for flights or additional services.

title: Delhi AQI improves to ‚Äòpoor‚Äô at 235; GRAP Stage-III lifted
content: Delhi's Air Quality Index has improved to 'poor' after being in the 'very poor' category, with a daily average AQI of 235 recorded. Favorable meteorological conditions led to the revocation of Stage-III of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP). Authorities urge continued adherence to GRAP Stages II and I to prevent further deterioration.

title: IPL: 'Won't even let SRK enter'- KKR's Mustafizur signing sparks political firestorm
content: Kolkata Knight Riders' signing of Bangladeshi bowler Mustafizur Rahman for the 2026 IPL has sparked a political firestorm. BJP leaders and religious groups are protesting, citing strained India-Bangladesh ties and alleged violence against minorities. Concerns were voiced that such sporting ties could be exploited, leading to threats against players and the franchise owner if matches are held in Kolkata.

title: Ira Khan‚ÄìNupur Shikhare celebrate 2nd anniversary; Nupur shares nostalgic 90s-style wedding video
content: Amir Khan's daughter, Ira, and husband Nupur Shikhare celebrated their second wedding anniversary with heartfelt social media posts. Nupur playfully called Ira brave for marrying him, while Ira described their marriage as the easiest and most satisfying experience.

title: 'Why drop Gill?': Yograj Singh lambasts Agarkar-led selection panel
content: Shubman Gill's omission from the T20 World Cup squad is causing significant discussion. The decision has raised questions about the selectors' planning, especially after Gill's recent vice-captaincy role. Former cricketer Yograj Singh criticized the move, highlighting the importance of backing players. This situation reignites conversations about selection philosophy and balancing immediate results with long-term team development.

title: 15 minutes for glow, 10 for delivery! Skincare and beauty race ahead on q-comm
content: Quick commerce apps are rapidly transforming into a significant beauty marketplace in India, with BPC products now a major growth driver.  Beauty sales on these platforms have surged 160% year-on-year, attracting global brands and contributing substantially to revenue for both direct-to-consumer and legacy players.

title: B'luru YouTuber held for forcing minor into car; accused claims she asked for lift
content: A 38-year-old YouTuber was arrested in Ramanagara for allegedly forcing a 17-year-old girl into his car and attempting to misbehave with her. The girl's father reported she was walking home alone when the incident occurred. The accused denies the allegations, claiming the girl requested a lift and later falsely accused him.

title: CBSE Class 10 English boards 2026: Expert advice to score higher
content: CBSE Class 10 English 2026 is less about fancy vocabulary and more about clear, examiner-friendly writing. Faculty from Sunbeam School, UP, share what actually moves marks: revise themes and author‚Äôs message, practise letters/analytical paragraphs in the right format, and treat grammar as easy marks. Write in your own voice, avoid memorised lines, present neatly, and interpret literature‚Äîdon‚Äôt narrate plots.

title: Affordability crisis in New York: Zohran Mamdani's focus on rising rents & more
content: New York City's newly elected Mayor Zohran Mamdani faces immense challenges, including a severe housing affordability crisis and rising living costs. His ambitious plans for rent freezes and affordable housing construction are met with financial hurdles.  With a projected budget shortfall and weakening federal support, Mamdani's success hinges on political organizing and navigating a complex economic landscape.

title: NBA insider reveals ‚Äúvery real‚Äù LeBron James trade talks involving Rich Paul
content: LeBron James' potential trade last offseason was 'very real.' According to NBA insider Brandon Robinson, Rich Paul reportedly engaged with at least four teams, including the Cavaliers, Warriors, Clippers, and Mavericks. With James entering free agency after the 2025-2026 season, his future remains open, with either a return to Cleveland or a move to Golden State being possibilities.

title: Trump invites Japan's Takaichi to US; focus on Indo-Pacific
content: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi has accepted an invitation from US President Donald Trump to visit the United States this spring. The leaders discussed strengthening the Japan-US alliance and promoting a free and open Indo-Pacific region. The visit, potentially in late March, follows recent regional tensions and Takaichi's remarks on Taiwan.

title: IND vs NZ: Vijay Hazare- Rishabh Pant at the heart of a fierce selection debate
content: Rishabh Pant's place in India's ODI squad is under scrutiny despite his past success. With a new captain and coaching philosophy emphasizing flexibility, selectors face a dilemma. Former players urge consistency, warning against repeating past mistakes and highlighting the need to either fully back Pant or identify a clear backup wicketkeeper before the next World Cup.

title: 'Ikkis' BO collection day 2: Agastya, Dharmendra‚Äôs war drama mints over Rs 12 crore worldwide
content: Agastya Nanda's debut in 'Ikkis' has opened to a strong Rs 7 crore on its first day, with a Rs 3.5 crore collection on day 2, bringing the India net total to Rs 10.5 crore. The war drama, featuring Dharmendra's last appearance, has outperformed 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' but trails behind the reigning 'Dhurandhar'.

title: MLB trade rumors: Braves eye $54m Astros star to boost roster health
content: Atlanta Braves are eyeing Japanese pitcher Tatsuya Imai to bolster their rotation ahead of the 2026 season due to existing pitching injuries. A potential trade with the Houston Astros could see Atlanta acquire Imai, offering immediate stability. This move would involve sending prospects Hurston Waldrep and Nacho Alvarez Jr. to Houston, securing much-needed pitching depth for the Braves.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection Day 29: Ranveer Singh starrer crosses Rs 1160 crore mark worldwide
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its reign at the box office, crossing Rs 1160 crore worldwide in its 5th week. The action-packed spy thriller has outperformed all regional, national, and international releases since its debut, demonstrating remarkable staying power and consistent audience engagement.

title: Who is he to question? BJP on New York Mayor Zohran Mamdani‚Äôs Umar Khalid note
content: BJP has strongly criticized New York Mayor Zohran Mamdani for expressing sympathy towards activist Umar Khalid, who is jailed in a Delhi riots conspiracy case. The party stated that an outsider has no right to question India's judiciary and democracy, especially by supporting someone accused of anti-India activities.

title: Indore water contamination: 200 still hospitalised, 32 in ICUs
content: Madhya Pradesh government took action following a contaminated water tragedy in Indore, removing municipal commissioner Dilip Kumar Yadav and suspending additional commissioner Rohit Sisoniya. The move comes as the death toll from the outbreak rose to 10. An in-charge superintendent engineer was also removed, with new officials appointed.

title: What is the mysterious humming noise in New Mexico that scientists still cannot explain
content: Residents in Taos, New Mexico, have long reported a mysterious low-frequency hum with no identifiable source. Despite extensive government and university research using advanced monitoring equipment, the sound remains elusive, baffling scientists. Similar unexplained hums have surfaced globally, highlighting the challenges in understanding these persistent, selective auditory phenomena and their potential effects.

title: ‚ÄòI will do jihad soon‚Äô: How Christian Sturdivant planned New Year‚Äôs Eve 'terrorist attack'
content: In a shocking turn of events, North Carolina's own 18-year-old Christian Sturdivant was apprehended just before the clock struck midnight on New Year's Eve. Investigators are alleging that he orchestrated a chilling plot, inspired by ISIS, targeting a local grocery store.

title: Gill returns to domestic cricket; but you can‚Äôt watch him: Here's why
content: Shubman Gill‚Äôs Vijay Hazare Trophy match for Punjab against Sikkim will be played behind closed doors, similar to recent games involving Virat Kohli. As per BCCI guidelines, no spectators or live broadcast will be allowed due to security concerns and lack of seating at the Jaipuria College ground. Gill and Arshdeep Singh will also play Punjab‚Äôs next match against Goa on January 6.

title: Bullet rain in Delhi: After Rs 3 crore extortion call, 2 dozen shots fired at businessman's car
content: A businessman's car and home in Rohini were targeted with over two dozen gunshots in a brazen extortion attempt.  The attack, demanding Rs 3 crore, suggests the return of gangster Himanshu Bhau, believed to be in the US.  Police are investigating the incident, which involved extensive gunfire and threats received via WhatsApp.

title: Close call: Plane with 55 onboard skids off runway in Nepal; video shows damaged aircraft
content: A Buddha Air aircraft overshot the runway while landing at Nepal's Bhadrapur Airport on Friday night, with all 51 passengers and four crew members escaping uninjured. The plane skidded off the airstrip by nearly 200 meters, coming to a halt in a grassy area with minor damage. A technical team has been dispatched to assess the aircraft.

title: Major boost: Govt clears 22 electronics parts projects at Rs 42,000 crore investment
content: India's electronics manufacturing sector receives a significant boost with 22 new component manufacturing proposals approved, attracting nearly Rs 42,000 crore in investments. Major players like Samsung, Foxconn, and Tata Electronics are set to enhance domestic production, aiming to reduce import reliance and bolster the nation's position as a global manufacturing hub.

title: Coloured diamonds shine brighter: Why are ultra rich chasing pink, blue stones?
content: Ultra-wealthy Indians are increasingly investing in rare pink, blue, and yellow diamonds, driving a 20-25% demand surge. These coloured stones, far rarer than white diamonds, are seen as both fashion statements and lucrative long-term assets. Their rising prices are fueled by global trends and increasing scarcity, with significant appreciation over the past two decades.

title: Govt directs X to remove all obscene, unlawful content; lens on AI app Grok
content: The Indian government has ordered social media platform X to immediately remove all obscene, sexually explicit, and unlawful content, particularly that generated by its AI app Grok. The Ministry of Electronics and IT issued a notice citing failure to comply with IT Act rules and demanding an action report within 72 hours, warning of legal consequences for non-compliance.

title: Loud Explosions, Low-Flying Aircraft Heard In Venezuela Capital After Trump Warns Of Ground Strikes
content: Loud explosions, accompanied by sounds resembling aircraft flyovers, were heard in Caracas around 2:00 am (0600 GMT) Saturday, an AFP journalist reported.

title: After UP, Rajasthan Mandates Newspaper Reading In Government Schools
content: The Rajasthan government has made daily newspaper reading compulsory in all government schools in an effort to promote reading habits, improve vocabulary and enhance general awareness among students.

title: Delhi Man Objects To Loud Music On New Year, Stabbed By Teens
content: New Year's evening left a trail of blood in its wake in Delhi with three stabbings and a partially burnt body staining the start of 2026.

title: Rashmi Shukla, Maharashtra's 1st Woman Top Cop, Retires
content: Rashmi Shukla, Maharashtra's first woman Director General of Police (DGP), retired on Saturday, having completed 37 and a half years in the Indian Police Service.

title: Election Commission Details 91.46 Lakh Voter Discrepancy Cases In West Bengal
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has furnished a breakup of the 91.46 lakh "logical discrepancy" cases identified in the course of "progeny-mapping" during the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) in West Bengal.

title: Telangana Passes Resolution Opposing Replacement Of MGNREGA With G Ram G
content: Amid opposition from the BJP members, the Telangana Legislative Assembly on Friday passed a resolution opposing the Centre's move to replace the MGNREGA with VB G RAM G Act and demanded that the former legislation be continued.

title: 6-Year-Old Girl Allegedly Raped, Thrown From Roof In UP, 2 Arrested
content: In a horrific incident, a six-year-old girl was allegedly raped and thrown off the roof by the assailant in Uttar Pradeshs Bulandshahr district, resulting in her death.

title: Delhi Wakes Up To Chilly Morning, Air Quality Improves To 'Poor' Category
content: The national capital on Saturday recorded a minimum temperature of 8.1 degrees Celsius, 1.2 notches above the season's average, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD).

title: Who Is Kim Ju Ae, Kim Jong Un's Daughter And North Korea's Likely Next Leader
content: Kim Ju Ae‚Äôs growing visibility alongside her father has led to intense speculation about her future role in North Korea‚Äôs tightly controlled leadership structure.

title: "They Earned Rs 102 Per Hour In 2025": Zomato Boss Defends Gig Work Model
content: Deepinder Goyal said Zomato delivery partners' average earnings per hour, excluding tips, stood at Rs 102 in 2025.

title: 3-Hour Drama, Security Scare As Drunk Man Climbs Temple Tower In Tirupati
content: A inebriated man climbed the tower of the ancient Sri Govindarajaswamy Temple in Tirupati, leading to a security scare and a three-hours-long operation to bring him to safety.

title: Myanmar's Military-Backed Party Leads After 1st Phase Of Controversial Polls
content: Myanmar's military-backed Union Solidarity and Development Party is leading after the first phase of a contentious general election, early results cited by state media showed, in the first vote since a 2021 coup.

title: NASA To Shut Largest Library, "Toss Away" Books? What Space Agency's Head Said
content: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) has hit out at the New York Times (NYT) over its report that the space agency's largest library at the Goddard Space Flight Center will be permanently closing, and books will be tossed away.

title: Inside US Teenager's "ISIS-Inspired" Attack Plan On New Year's Eve
content: According to investigators, Christian Sturdivant (18) had planned to attack people at a grocery store and a Burger King fast-food restaurant.

title: "Mom, Happy New Year": Missing Son's Last Message Before Swiss Fire
content: The last message Laetitia Brodard received from her son Arthur came just minutes into 2026, as he was celebrating New Year's Eve with friends in the Swiss ski resort town Crans-Montana.

title: How India's Richest Civic Body BMC Earns And What It Spends On
content: BMC's revenue has grown steadily over the decade and maintains a strong fixed deposit, interest on which forms a portion of its annual revenue.

title: "Stole Phones, Misbehaved": Nagpur Parents Chain Son, 12, For 2 Months
content: A shocking incident has emerged from Maharashtra's Nagpur, where parents tied their 12-year-old son with iron chains and padlocks to correct his "misbehaviour".

title: Tamil Nadu Congress In Turmoil Ahead Of Assembly Polls
content: The Tamil Nadu Congress has landed in fresh trouble ahead of the 2026 Assembly elections, with MP Jothimani openly flagging internal conflict and another party functionary resigning

title: CFP quarterfinal takeaways: Ole Miss' wild upset, Indiana's dominance and more
content: the second edition of the college football playoff quarterfinals gave us two classics and two statement wins . on Wednesday, no. 10 Miami rode an early 14-0 burst and a clutch late touchdown drive to a 24-14 upset of no. 2 Ohio State . the Hurricanes advanced to the semis to face no. 6 Ole Miss .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.
